text.__SUMMARY__: Betula szechuanica, the Sichuan birch or Szechuan birch, is a birch species native to Sichuan, China, conical in shape, growing to 20 meters in height, with white bark, yellow-green male catkins or green female catkins, and dark, blue-green leaves.
text.Synonyms:
Betula platyphylla var. szechuanica
Betula mandshurica var. szechuanica
Betula japonica var. szechuanica
text.References:
GBIF entry
Alison Hoblyn and Marie O'Hara, Green Flowers: Unexpected Beauty for the Garden, Container Or Vase, page 40, Timber Press, 2009. ISBN 9780881929195.
